content.title: Gopinath Munde Shetkari Apghat Suraksha Sanugrah Audhan Yojana
content.details: The Gopinath Munde Shetkari Apghat Suraksha Sanugrah Audhan Yojana provides financial assistance to farmers or their heirs in the event of accidents leading to death or permanent disability.
benefits: Failure of two eyes or two organs due to accident - Rs.2,00,000/-
Failure of one eye and one organ due to accident - Rs.2,00,000/-
Failure of one eye or one organ due to accident - Rs.1,00,000/-
eligibility: All registered account holder farmers in the state as per revenue records in the age group of 10 to 75 years
Wife of accident victim/husband of accident victim
exclusions: Attempted suicide, suicide or deliberate self-inflicted injury
An accident committed in violation of law for the purpose of a crime
An accident while under the influence of drugs
content.application_process: Farmers should contact the nearest Agriculture Supervisor of Agriculture Department or Taluka Agriculture Officer of their Taluka or District Superintendent Agriculture Officer office of their taluka.
documents_required: The original 7/12 containing his name as a farmer
Village sample no. Extract of 6 C means the inheritance record approved as per the records of the village laborer Talathi as the heir of the farmers
Excerpt of Village Sample No. 6-D i.e. record of alteration from which the name of the accident victim appears on 7/12
Document of birth date for age proof
Death certificate in case of death
In case of disability, attested copy of medical certificate of permanent disability issued by Medical Officer or District Surgeon must be submitted
Valid driving license if the accident victim is a driver

faqs.question: Which farmers are benefited under this claim scheme?
faqs.answer: All registered account holder farmers in the state as per revenue records in the age group of 10 to 75 years.

faqs.question: Can farmers with common farm apply for this scheme?
What type of permanent disability covered in this scheme?
faqs.answer: Permanent disability covered in this scheme includes failure of two eyes or two organs, failure of one eye and one organ, and failure of one eye or one organ due to accident.

faqs.question: What care should be taken by the farmers while submitting the claim proposal?
faqs.answer: Farmers should intimate the nearest agriculture office about the accident and submit the complete claim proposal with all the prescribed documents within 30 days.

faqs.question: What arrangement is there for any dispute arising from the approval of claims proposal?
faqs.answer: A District Level District Appellate Committee has been formed under the chairmanship of Hon. District Collector.

faqs.question: Are applications for this scheme open throughout the year?
faqs.answer: Yes, the scheme will be applicable for 24 hours of every day during the prescribed period.

faqs.question: What is the application fee?
faqs.answer: There is no fee for application.
